Text.Value: Want to see the other spells I can cast? They're much worse.
Back off. Or I'll use your bones for lockpicks instead.
*Perhaps that lock was better left intact...*
*Tampering with that lock might be the last thing you ever do. This witness will make sure of that.*
Try to talk your way out.
*You're being reported. It seems breaking and entering isn't permitted.*
*It seems that little spell just earned you a meeting with the guards.*
*You're expected to pay with your life, not your gold.*
*Your gold is of little interest. It won't buy your freedom this time.*
*Your spell was hardly violent, but this guard doesn't believe the punishment should fit the crime. It should be much, much worse.*
*The lock you tampered with remains intact. The same may not be true of you, once this guard decides your punishment.*
Take this and let's have no more unpleasantness. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
*That might work on more gullible individuals, but this guard sees right through you. You're under arrest.*
*You've successfully persuaded the guard that you belong in a cell.*
Locks are made to be opened. Very silly to arrest someone for doing what comes naturally.
The lock is still intact. No harm done, is there?
*Better gold in the palm than a sword in the throat.*
*Your gold was more than enough to defuse the situation. You're free to go.*
Attack.
*It seems that spell might well be your last...*
*Prison guards rarely take kindly to prisoners tampering with locks. This one is no exception.*
*Your lock-tampering caught the guard's eye. What will your next move be?*
*That spell usually results in a lock being opened. Unfortunately, this time it's about to get you locked up.*
*You managed to get away with that. Better not try your luck too often.*
*That settles the matter. Crisis averted.*
*Your spell was noticed. You suspect the grown-ups will have something to say about it. Here they come now...*
*One little spell and this child's telling on you. Spoilsport.*

EditorData.NodeContext: Thirrd warning for Civilians: call guards, or regular warning again.

Text.Value: *Your lack of wealth might make bribing this individual rather difficult.*
*It's customary to possess gold in order to bribe someone with it.*
I'm no criminal - I noticed the lock was damaged and was casting a spell to repair it.
I'm a locksmith! You really want to arrest me for doing my job?
Follow to prison.
*The price of freedom runs higher than you thought. A prison cell beckons...*
*Your gold buys contempt, but not freedom. You're about to be detained.*

Synopsis: A player used a knock spell, and the NPC saw the player when they did so, and immediately reacts to the player.
